events.name: Dart Flight School
events.description: We are happy to announce our first meetup. Anders Johnsen from Google Aarhus office will be presenting Dart to the local developer community.

events.name: Building Web Apps Like a Pro using Google App Engine
events.description:
Google Developer Expert Panayiotis Lipiridis will be talking about Google App Engine. Topics of Talk:
-What is Google App Engine and why would anyone care to use it
-How to build applications on GAE using gae-init as a starting point
-Why using CoffeeScript instead of pure Javascript
-Why using LessCSS instead of pure CSS
-How could someone go global with i18n and L10n support

We would like to ask you to mark your attendance here on the event, but it is also recommended that you get a ticket (free) on our Koliseo event http://goo.gl/Bo7aHn . This helps us better understand how many people are planning to come and better prepare for it. ﻿

events.name: Google I/O Extended
events.description:
As you all know Google I/O is coming up on June 25-26. GDG Aarhus will be hosting an extended version of the conference, where we can hang out, watch the keynote together and discuss the interesting topics, but most importantly just have fun. We will be making the schedule of the two days as we go, let us know if you have any specific requests for this awesome and exciting event. See you on June 25th!

Note the change of address:
Trifork A/S, Margrethepladsen 4, DK-8000 Aarhus C
(Entrance from Sonnesgade)﻿

events.name: Google IO Extended 2015 Aarhus
events.description:
It's time for the most exciting event of the year - and you are invited!

The ultra short version: Live streaming of the Google IO keynote, free food and drinks, awesome like-minded people and maybe even some Google swag

Google IO will be full of announcements on all your favorite products and technologies. Whether you live in the Google cloud, can't wait to get you hands dirty with the next version of Android or are just plain crazy about the new wearables, IoT, Chrome, or one of the myriads of cool technologies and APIs - the keynote outlines all the biggest news of the year!

GDG Aarhus is very excited to use this as our first event of 2015 and first of many awesome things to happen going forward. We are also super excited to do this in collaboration with Trifork, who have offered to host it as part of the GOTO nights series of events.

You should join us for this event because:

- You want to be among the first to know about what awesome stuff is going to happen from Google

- It is much more fun to experience this together with a lot of other developers and discuss it afterwards

- Trifork will be sponsoring in their own words: "plenty of food, snacks and beverages and hopefully lots of like-minded nerds - all kinds are welcome, even Windows and iOS developers ;-)"  

- You want to be part of growing GDG Aarhus into one of the best and most vibrant Google Developer Groups around

- You just might be lucky and get you hands on some of the Google IO swag that we have ordered for this GDG event.

We will live stream the keynote starting at 18.00 Danish time, and be sure to be there 30 minutes before so you get a good seat and settle in for experiences what the next year of Google will bring us. 

Remember to spread the word and bring your friends too!

NB: As Trifork need to plan seats, food and drinks for the event, you must also sign up at their site here: http://gotocon.com/cph-2015/freeevent/index.jsp?eventOID=6849

events.name: Dart Flight School
events.description:
Dart is a cohesive, scalable platform for building apps that run on the web or on servers such as with Google Cloud Platform. Use the Dart language, libraries, and tools to write anything from simple scripts to full-featured apps.

Dart Flight Schools are events to help developers learn Dart. The Dart development team from Google Aarhus is hosting this Dart Flight School event, so this could also be your chance to interact a bit with folks directly responsible for this new technology stack.

This Dart Flight School includes a tech talk and a hands-on code lab and we will make sure to have plenty of time for questions and discussions.

In GDG Aarhus we are happy to be part of this exciting event which also falls under the program of Internet Week Denmark and will be hosted by our local Googlers in Aarhus, including Kasper Lund who will running the event. Please sign up both here and on the official sign up page: http://internetweekdenmark.com/events/dart-flight-school

This is a hands-on code lab, so bring your own laptop and be sure to check out https://www.dartlang.org/ to get the full experience!

events.name: Android Aarhus #1
events.description:
This will be the first of (hopefully) many meetups focused on Android and the Android ecosystem. Of course we be talk about what has happened since Google I/O - not least the official launch of Android 6.0 : Marshmallow - but this will also be the event where we discuss the nature of this series of meetups and topics for the coming events. So come and join to be a part of it from the very beginning - and help shape it into a vibrant community for Android oriented people in and around Aarhus! 

We will kick off the event at 16.30 with some drinks, snacks and networking and move on to the loosely scheduled program starting at 17.00.  

Besides the general discussion, fun and lots of opportunity for networking the event will also feature two short talks:

"Hello Marshmallow!"

Kasper Løvborg Jensen - Chief Wizard at Leafcastle Labs and Associate Professor at Aarhus University School of Engineering


"Blurring the lines: experiences with material design"

Tobias Fjelsted Alrøe and Jesper Lysgaard Rasmussen - founders at Appdictive

(more info will follow, stay tuned on the Android Aarhus facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/groups/AndroidAarhus/ )

The event is open for everybody so spread the word and bring your friends - however, please make sure that everybody does register AT LATEST on the night before (Wednesday) so we can plan accordingly :)

Looking forward to seeing you there!

Android Aarhus is organized by: Google Developer Group Aarhus.

This event is hosted by Incuba and drinks will be sponsored by Leafcastle Labs.
events.how_to_find_us: Go to the main entrance on Åbogade (big glass door) and somebody can let you in. We will be downstairs under the main cantina.

events.name: Internet of Programmable Things
events.description:
The Internet of Programmable Things

With Kasper Lund from Google

Developing software for a connected, embedded device often makes you want to throw it out the window. How do we turn the "internet of throwable things" into the "internet of programmable things" and make developers productive even when they are working on low-end devices?

Come and hear what the Google team in Aarhus is working on with regards to the internet of programmable things and use this unique opportunity to meet some of the people behind the project. We have been told that there might even be live demos of some of the most cutting edge stuff.

We will kick off the event at 16.30 with some drinks and snacks and move on with the scheduled program starting at 17.00. As usual there will be plenty of opportunities for general discussion, fun and networking. We aim to end around 19.00.

The event is open for all - so spread the word and bring your friends! As always, the event will be in English.

Google is sponsoring drinks and snacks, but please register so we know how many people to prepare for :)

Looking forward to seeing you all!

events.name: Android Aarhus #2: Painless Persistence in a Disconnected World
events.description:
This will be the second Android Aarhus meetup - Xmas edition!

Our featured speaker is Christian Melchior from the Danish startup Realm - a graduate company from the world leading Y Combinator program in Silicon Valley. He will give a presentation titled:

"Painless Persistence in a Disconnected World"

Abstract:

"In a world where users have ever higher expectations from the apps they use, having data always available, even when the device is offline has become increasingly important.

In this talk we will go through different ways of saving data on the phone and introduce Realm as a replacement for SQLite and ORM's.

Through an example app it will be demonstrated that thinking "Offline first" not only affects your apps architecture for the better, but also results in happier users."

We will kick off the event at 16.30 with some drinks, snacks and networking and move on to the scheduled program starting at 17.00. 

The event is - as always - open and free for everybody so spread the word and bring your friends - however, please make sure that everybody does register AT LATEST on the night before (Wednesday) so we can plan accordingly :)

Looking forward to seeing you there!

Android Aarhus is organized by: Google Developer Group Aarhus.

This event is hosted by Aarhus University and drinks/snacks will be sponsored by it-forum

events.name: Android Aarhus #3: Tapping into the Mind of the User
events.description:
Finally everything aligned so we can now officially announce our next GDG Aarhus / Android Aarhus meetup!

In this installment we will focus on one of the most important factors for the eventual success of any app: the user experience.

Our featured speaker is Janne Jul Jensen. She is Senior UX Architect with LEGO and a frequent speaker on UX at international software conferences such as DroidCon. For more than a decade she has worked in academia and the software industry as an expert in usability, human-computer interaction and interaction design - including 5 years with Trifork where she designed apps for companies such as Danske Bank, Bilka and DSB.

She will give an interactive talk on some core concepts in usability and UX that will enable you to create better and more intuitive apps for your users. The talk is titled:

"Tapping into the Mind of the User"

Abstract:

"More than ever, today's users are expecting a great and smooth user experience from their apps - and creating intuitive user interfaces has become an essential skill for successful development teams. Design guidelines helps a lot, but what exactly makes some apps super easy to use while others leave the users puzzled or frustrated?

In this talk Janne Jul Jensen will take us inside the mind of the user to explain why some things are just so darn hard for users She will explain how we can make apps with user interfaces that “work” by leveraging the way our brains are wired. Do not miss out on this opportunity to learn first hand from one of the top UX professionals."

We will follow the usual protocol and kick off the event at 16.30 with some drinks, snacks and networking and then move on to the scheduled program starting at 17.00.  Should be ample time for good discussion during and after.

The content of this event is suitable for developers, designers and business people alike, and as usual: The event (including drinks and snacks) is open and free for all – but please register so we know how much to buy for you guys :)

PS: Would be great if you would help spread the word and link to this meetup event!

Android Aarhus is organized by: Google Developer Group Aarhus.

This event is hosted by Aarhus University and drinks/snacks will be sponsored by our local Google Aarhus

events.name: Dart Codelab
events.description:
The next GDG Aarhus event will be a Dart Codelab presented by a whole bunch of great engineers from Google.

Dart is an open-source, scalable programming language, with robust libraries and runtimes, for building web, server, and mobile apps.

Dart Codelabs are events to help developers learn Dart. The Dart development team from Google Aarhus is hosting this event, so this is your chance to interact with the folks directly responsible for this new technology stack. The session includes a quick introduction to the language and a hands-on codelab, so make sure to bring a laptop with the dev tools installed and come hack with us! We'll make sure to have plenty of time for questions and discussions and we will showcase some of the more recent areas Dart is expanding to.

The event is free including pizza, snacks and drinks - just remember to register so we know how much food to buy.

NB: Before the Codelab, be sure to install the software on your laptop (essentially complete step 0 of the codelab on github) :

https://github.com/floitsch/dart-irc-codelab

Get Dart:

https://www.dartlang.org/downloads/
events.how_to_find_us: Codelab has been moved to the Google Aarhus offices in the Incuba Building, entrance on first floor.

events.name: Google Cloud & Kubernetes
events.description:
The era of cloud computing is upon us, and this paradigm shift means new ways of doing software development. Things that did not seem possible a few years back is now right at your fingertips. Google and other big cloud providers are abstracting away the hard and complicated systems behind the cloud, whether it is image recognition, translation or other services. This allows you as a developer to build cool new things and to be able to handle customers’ expectations on an unprecedented amount of connected devices.

This event will feature three segments:

1) a short overview of the state of the art for the Google Cloud Platform for application developers based on announcements from the recent NEXT conference. Including some general patterns for app backends with Firebase and EndPoints/App Engine, Machine Learning in the cloud and a live code/demo of Cloud Vision API on Android. (Kasper L. J.);

2) a general introduction to cloud computing and how Google Cloud Platform works (Kasper N. & Martin);

3) and finally a detailed introduction to Google’s Kubernetes, which is a cluster management and scheduling tool. To visualize the ideas and key concepts of Kubernetes we will demonstrate it using a Raspberry Pi cluster (Kasper N. & Martin).

Presenters will be:

Kasper Nissen, IT Minds
Kasper is a software engineer with at passion for Cloud computing. He is currently exploring this passion in writing his master's thesis about Cloud Computing, Microservice architectures, and Kubernetes infrastructure. Beside his studies he works at IT Minds as a Software Developer, and further tries to disrupt the driving school industry through his startup, Drivelogger.

Martin Jensen, IT Minds
Martin is a curious software developer and master’s thesis student with a great interest in cloud computing. Currently he is writing his master’s thesis on resilience in cloud computing and how it can be used in a teaching setting. Additionally he works as a software developer at IT Minds and likes to try out with new technologies.Martin Jensen, IT Minds 


Kasper Løvborg Jensen, Leafcastle Labs / Aarhus Uni
Besides running Leafcastle Labs, Kasper is an associate professor in the Software Engineering department at Aarhus University School of Engineering. He mainly works in the intersection of mobile and wearable computing, context-awareness and human-computer interaction/UX while keeping an eye on how to leverage the power of the cloud.

As usual, the event is free for all - so spread the word and bring your friends!

The drinks and snacks are sponsored by IDA Embedded and Google :)

NB: As the event is co-sponsored by IDA Embedded - If you are a member of IDA, please also sign up on their site as this will "generate" more snacks/drinks for the event :D

https://universe.ida.dk/arrangement/google-cloud-kubernetes-318717/

events.name: Google I/O Extended Aarhus 2016
events.description:
The biggest Google event of the year is upon us: Google I/O 2016!

And like last year we are joining forces with the good folks at Trifork and hosting an official Google I/O Extended 2016 Keynote Live-Streaming Event!

We will be streaming the Google I/O 2016 keynote on a large screen at the Trifork, Aarhus headquarters.

There will be plenty of food, snacks and beverages and hopefully lots of like-minded nerds - all kinds are welcome, even Windows and iOS developers ;-).

There will also be some swag available for the earliest registrations for this event - we will try to get enough for everybody, but it will be first come first serve.

So please join us for a great event with lots of new exciting announcements - and remember to bring your friends along too (they don't have to be nerds).

The keynote is expected to start at 18:00 Danish local time, but we will most likely have some special things lined up before the keynote, so we have initially scheduled the event for 17.00 (THIS MAY CHANGE!). Regardless, make sure to come early and get the good seats.

NB: Trifork is hosting the event and have their own event management system, so on top of RSVP'ing here - make sure you also sign up for the event here:

https://secure.trifork.com/cph-2016/freeevent/index.jsp?eventOID=7675

<a href="http://www.meetup.com/Google-Developer-Group-Aarhus/"></a>

events.name: Google I/O 2016 Recap
events.description:
Google I/O 2016 is in the books – and a record 100+ GDG Aarhus devs were at the I/O Extended event to watch the keynote at our last meetup. Over the three day conference Google delivered a blur of news, updates, upgrades and visions for the future, and now it’s time to summarize and discuss all the main announcements – and how this effect us as developers.

Our featured speaker at this event is Filip Bruun-Bech Larsen, who is a Google Developer Expert in web technologies and the main organizer of the Angular Aarhus meetup series. Besides sharing his personal experiences and takeaways from Google I/O 2016, he will also give his “state of the union” overview of web frontend development.

Kasper Løvborg Jensen will pitch in with his favorite highlights from Shoreline Amphitheater and lead a discussion around what's new in Android and on Firebase/Cloud (We will also have a dedicated in-depth event about Android N and the new dev tools after the summer holiday!).

Event is in English and as always: free - including snacks and drinks sponsored by Google

events.name: Firebase Intro with Android and Beyond
events.description:
Firebase was all over Google I/O and is one of the hottest products under the Google umbrella – so there is no better time to get up to speed with the newest developments. Not only does this "Backend-as-a-Service" pack an impressive amount of features on its own, it is also applicable across a broad range of platforms thanks to strong integrations and libraries for mobile, web, IoT devices and the rest the Google Cloud Platform. In their own words, it “…gives you the tools to develop high-quality apps, grow your user base, and earn more money. We cover the essentials so you can monetize your business and focus on your users.”
Check out: https://firebase.google.com/docs/

Program:
[masked]: Drinks/snacks & networking
[masked]: Intro and short update on GDG Aarhus (Kasper)
[masked]: [Tech Talk] “All your Firebase are belong to Us” (Kasper)
[masked]: Short break
[masked]: [Open Mic] Firebase War Stories (open mic/discussion - send email if you would like to presents something)
[masked].00+: [Codelab] Firebase Android Codelab and/or Free hacking + networking In the talk Kasper Løvborg Jensen will give an overview of the core aspects of this powerful suite of features and tools for creating, deploying and scaling up your applications. Through code examples, he will demonstrate how to wire together both your native Android (or iOS) apps with a real-time database. Maybe even synch it up with some live sensor input from IoT devices. Maybe even add a hosted web interface for monitoring those devices. With Firebase, everything is possible! ☺

After the talks participants are encouraged to hang out and get some hands-on experience through the Firebase Android Codelab provided by Google (see details below) – so bring your laptop! Bio
Kasper Løvborg Jensen is an associate professor at Aarhus University School of Engineering where he is leading the brand new ORBIT Lab initiative which is set to launch very soon; essentially an open hackerspace/innovation lab for students, academics and industry professionals to build awesome new things together by using and fusing cutting-edge technologies. Kasper is passionate about all things tech and software (especially mobile, wearable and cloud) alongside UX, entrepreneurship and innovation. Outside research and teaching he is also consulting and running startups out of Leafcastle Labs and organizing GDG Aarhus.

As usual, the event - including drinks and snacks - is free for all - so spread the word and bring your friends, but please RSVP to this event so we can buy supplies accordingly! ☺

The event will be sponsored by Google and IDA Embedded and hosted by AU Engineering

NB: As the event is co-sponsored by IDA Embedded - If you are a member of IDA, please also sign up on their site as this will "generate" more snacks/drinks for the event :D

IDA members sign up:

https://universe.ida.dk/arrangement/firebase-with-android-and-beyond-320327/

events.name: Introducing the Realm Object Server
events.description:
Making apps that work offline is hard, making them synchronize data between devices even more so. But that doesn't have to be the case.

Realm just launched a new server that promises to enable all developers to make reactive and collaborative apps a breeze. We will take a look at how easy it really can be to synchronize data between your devices and server with a few lines of code.

This is a great opportunity to learn about one of the most innovative data platforms for mobile applications - straight from the source. Our featured speaker will be Christian Melchior from Realm

Christian is an Android developer focused on making Realm's Android SDK the default choice for developers. He has a strong love for clean, approachable code that's fast to boot. Prior to Realm, he got a MSc. in Computer Science from Aarhus University and built award-winning apps at Trifork.

And be sure to check out: www.realm.io

Program:

• We will meet at 16.30 and get started with some drinks and snacks.

• We kick off the actual talk at 17.00 which we expect to last for about an hour including discussion.

• After that there will be networking and more snacks/drinks.

As usual, the event - including drinks and snacks - is free for all. So spread the word and bring your friends, but please RSVP to this event so we can buy supplies accordingly! ☺

The event will be sponsored by Google and hosted by AU Engineering / ORBIT Lab
events.how_to_find_us: The usual place, see map. Knock if door is closed

events.name: Google Hash Code / GDG Space session
events.description:
GDG Aarhus and ORBIT Lab are hosting the Google Hash Code competition: https://hashcode.withgoogle.com/ Unfortunately it looks like we do not have any teams competing from Aarhus, so instead we will open up the lab to test a new concept we call "GDG Spaces". This means open lab for GDG members to come and work on their favorite projects, pick up and test some new tech in the lab (we have a large selection of gadgets and equipment for developing applications for mobile, wearable, embedded, IoT, VR, cloud, etc) or just discuss and have fun with fellow GDG members. We will also try to stream the Hash Code competition

Experimental concept and limited spaces, so please only sign up if you know you can make it :)
events.how_to_find_us: See map in details section - doors will be locked after 17.00 so call 52x8x06x (x=4) if you arrive later

events.name: Next ’17 Extended - Aarhus
events.description:
Google Cloud Next conference keynote & codelabs

*More details to follow*

We will watch the keynotes, discuss and engage with Google Cloud based code labs on selected topics such as: Firebase, Cloud Vision and TensorFlow

Here is a short snippet from the description from Google on the keynote session: link

"

Next '17 is a unique opportunity to hear from the Google leaders who are helping define the future of the cloud, including Diane Greene, SVP of Google Cloud; Urs Hölzle, SVP of Technical Infrastructure, Google Cloud; Brian Stevens, VP of Cloud Platforms and Prabhakar Raghavan, VP of Apps, to name a few.

In addition, we're excited that Sundar Pichai, CEO of Google and Eric Schmidt, Executive Chairman of Alphabet will be sharing their vision in keynotes at Next.  

You'll also have the chance to hear from some of the brightest minds in technology, including Fei-Fei Li, Chief Scientist for ML/AI, Google Cloud and Professor of Computer Science at Stanford; Vint Cerf, Google's Chief Internet Evangelist and Sam Ramji, VP of Compute and Developer Services, Google Cloud. We have more exciting industry leaders that will be joining us onstage, so stay tuned for more updates.

"

events.name: Firebase, Android & "Open GDG Space" session at ORBIT Lab with VR&AR demos
events.description:
NB: We will start in the Shannon building in lecture room S003 then move to ORBIT Lab (this is not the usual place, but right next to it). Use the door towards the Edison building (Finlandsgade 22)

16:00 - 16:30: Arrival and Networking
16:30 - 17:30: Tech talk and demos on Firebase by Kasper Løvborg Jensen. He will give an introductory 360 tour of the platform tools and APIs and how you can use Firebase to supercharge your applications. Examples will mainly be made in Android/Java but also cover backend and Google Cloud integration perspectives.
17:30 - 19:00+: ORBIT Lab will be open for hacking and exploring new technologies with the opportunity to try out some of our gear for Virtual Reality (HTC Vive, Oculus Rift, Android + Daydream) and Augmented Reality (Android + Tango). You can also work through some of the Firebase code labs or just bring your laptop and work on some of your own projects together with like-minded techies.

The tech talk will be in one of the auditoriums in the Shannon building and depending on how many we are we will spread out there and in ORBIT Lab (Codd building) for the following.

Bring your laptop and fellow developers! And remember to sign up so we have a chance to get snacks and drinks accordingly.
events.how_to_find_us: We will start in the Shannon building in S003 then move to ORBIT Lab

events.name: I/O Extended Aarhus 2017
events.description:
Event update: 
Please note: The event starts at 17:00 (Danish time), so please be in time in order to get the good seats, get some SWAG and hear the Google presentation before the actual keynote. There will be code! Important: In order to get up to 3rd floor (normally not open to public) on DOKK1, you HAVE to find the elevators on the ground floor (parking lot floor) and take a designated elevator. There will be signs and Trifork employees helping you get up to 3rd floor in batches.

Wednesday, the 17th of May, Google will stream the Keynote from their annual Google I/O Conference. This is THE biggest event for developers working with Google technologies and we get to hear about what's new and upcoming for the coming year.

Trifork together with Google Developer Group Aarhus wish to provide you with the chance of seeing the keynote in a nice setting with other like-minded nerds – hopefully creating an exciting environment and good discussion. So join us at Dokk1 in Aarhus for this Google I/O Extended event.

As an added bonus, some of our local Google Aarhus engineers have promised to join us and there will be a talk about some of the newest developments from the teams they are part of (more details to come) before or after the keynote. so don't miss out on this chance to interact directly with Googlers and pick their brains about software development and tech.

At the event, we will provide food and drinks throughout the evening. The Keynote itself will be streamed on a large screen.

We hope to see you for an entertaining and exciting evening full of surprises and announcements from Google. 

As always - it is free to attend, but you must sign up through here on meetup. Seats are limited.

See you there!

events.name: GDD Europe 2017 Extended - Aarhus
events.description:
Greetings developers,

Google is hosting the Google Developer Days (GDD) Europe in Krakow, Poland on Sep 5-6 with an exciting program of announcements, tech talks, code labs and other goodies for the developer community. Many of the talks will be live-streamed, so we will use this opportunity to open ORBIT Lab for the community to come and watch the events with fellow developers - and hack on whatever project or codelab you would like.

The full program is available on https://developers.google.com/events/gdd-europe/ but the following selection of talks for sep 5th are live streamed:

10:00 - 11:00: Day 1 Keynote

11:30 - 12:15: What's up with Internet of Things and the Google Assistant

12:15 - 13:00: Android Things: The IoT Platform for Everyone

13:00 - 13:45: Zero to App: Live coding a universal translator with Firebase

13:45 - 14:15: What can I do with Cloud Functions for Firebase? All the things.

14:45 - 15:30: In record time: How we quickly built a serverless, modern app with Firebase and Flutter

15:30 - 16:15: ML APIs by Example

16:15 - 17:00: Diving into O and the Support Library

16:15 - 17:00: Google Cloud IoT Core Technical Deep Dive

17:00 - 17:45: Introducing ARCore: Augmented Reality at Android Scale

Besides live streaming some of the best talks directly from GDD Europe, we will hold this event over two days in the "Open Space" format. This means you are free to bring your laptop and fellow developers to come hang out and build cool stuff.

events.name: GDD Europe 2017 Extended - Aarhus (day 2)
events.description:
Greetings developers,

Google is hosting the Google Developer Days (GDD) Europe in Krakow, Poland on Sep 5-6 with an exciting program of announcements, tech talks, code labs and other goodies for the developer community. Many of the talks will be live-streamed, so we will use this opportunity to open ORBIT Lab for the community to come and watch the events with fellow developers - and hack on whatever project or codelab you would like.

The full program is available on https://developers.google.com/events/gdd-europe/ but the following selection of talks for sep 6th are live streamed:

10:00 - 10:45 Day 2 Keynote

11:00 - 11:45: Machine Learning with TensorFlow

11:45 - 12:30: Fundamentals of Google Cloud Platform: A Guided Tour

12:30 - 13:15: Containers, Kubernetes and Google Cloud

13:15 - 13:45: The Year Ahead in Global Tech Policy

14:15 - 15:00: Frameworks and Tools for Progressive Web Apps

14:15 - 15:45: Hands-on with the Google Cloud Vision and Natural Language APIs

15:00 - 15:45: Developing conversational Assistant apps using Actions on Google

15:45 - 16:30: Performance tooling

15:45 - 16:30: App to 60 - Using Firebase on your existing app

16:30 - 17:15: Intro to DeepMind

17:15 - 18:00: Closing Keynote

Besides live streaming some of the best talks directly from GDD Europe, we will hold this event over two days in the "Open Space" format. This means you are free to bring your laptop and fellow developers to come hang out and build cool stuff.

events.name: Prototyping with Firebase
events.description:
At this meetup we will look at Firebase as a platform for powering mobile applications - specifically how we can take advantage of the services and tools to rapidly prototype applications and test out ideas and features.

Check out this short (1m 14s) video for an intro: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O17OWyx08Cg

Or dive deeper at:  https://firebase.google.com/

Program:

16:00 - 16:30: Arrival and Networking

16:30 - 17:30: Introduction to the fast evolving Firebase platform and overview of the tools and services available for developers by Kasper Løvborg Jensen. The talk will focus on how to use Firebase to supercharge the development in early stages (on Android in particular) with Firebase but also touch on other integrations on other platforms and how to leverage other Google Cloud Platform services.

17:30 - 18.00: War stories and pro tips: open mic for the community to share their experiences with Firebase and pass on advise to people looking to get going with the platform.

18:00 - 19:00+: Firebase Code Labs and free hacking. We will move from the auditorium to ORBIT Lab in the next building. Besides Firebase, this will also be a chance to explore a wide range of other technologies and try out some of our gear for e.g. VR (HTC Vive, Oculus Rift, Pixel/Android + Daydream) and AR (Android + Tango).

Remember to bring your laptop and fellow developers!

Registration is mandatory, as we need to know how many we need to buy drinks and snacks for. If you want to hang around and hack after the main program, we can organize some pizza :)

Looking forward to seeing you all!
events.how_to_find_us: We will start in the Shannon building in lecture room S003 then move to ORBIT Lab. Use the door towards the Edison building (Finlandsgade 22)

events.name: ORBIT Lab launch event : Open lab and reception
events.description:
We are officially launching ORBIT Lab, which also serves as GDG Space Aarhus for our community. Come and have a look at the new and extended lab, and chat with fellow developers, students, researchers and people from industry.

Check orbitlab.au.dk for more details on the lab

There will be drinks and snacks

PS: Don't worry if you can't make it - we will also have a proper GDG event to mark the opening in the new year as well :)

events.name: DartConf 2018 Extended Aarhus (Keynote Live-Stream)
events.description:
• What we'll do
DartConf is here! Live from Los Angeles, Google (including our local Aarhus engineering team) will give an overview of the state of the (D)art – and hopefully tell us about the future for Dart, Flutter, AngularDart, and other related projects (Fuchsia?). We will live-stream the full keynote and one or more talks in the program, so this is your chance to get all the new announcements live together with your fellow developers in Aarhus. “Dart's mission is to make it possible to build next-generation user experiences — on the web, on iOS, on Android, everywhere. DartConf is the premier event that connects Flutter and AngularDart developers together, and to the Google engineers who work on these projects.”
(Source: DartConf homepage, https://events.dartlang.org/2018/dartconf/ )

Make sure to bring you laptop if you want to show off some of your Dart / Flutter projects, or maybe just get your dev environment set up for some exploratory hacking!

Program:
[masked] : [GDG Open Space*] Free hacking with Dart, Flutter, AngularDart
[masked] : Food and drinks
[masked] : GDG Aarhus open discussion: what should we plan for 2018
[masked] : [Keynote] Live stream from Los Angeles with the DartConf keynote
19.45-? : [Talks] Continued live stream from talks at DartConf
19.45-? : Discussions and Dart/Flutter hacking

Check out the latest docs and info on Dart here https://www.dartlang.org/ and Flutter https://flutter.io/

• What to bring
Laptop (optional)

• Important to know
As usual, the event - including drinks and snacks - is free for all, so spread the word and bring your friends, but please RSVP to this event so we can buy supplies accordingly! The event is sponsored by Google and hosted by AU Engineering / ORBIT Lab

*GDG Open Space is a concept we have been working on for a while in GDG Aarhus in collaboration with AU Engineering and ORBIT Lab. In ORBIT Lab (www.orbitlab.au.dk) we recently launched our tech hub situated right in the heart of Katrinebjerg am

events.name: Google Hash Code 2018
events.description:
• What we'll do
Hash Code is a team programming competition organized by Google for students and industry professionals across Europe, the Middle East and Africa. You pick your team and programming language, we pick a Google engineering problem for you to solve. GDG Aarhus together with ORBIT Lab is organizing a hub for the competition and we have a number of teams signed up already - but there is still time to create a team! You can also join as a spectator and hang out.

Sign up for the competition and see more info here: https://hashcode.withgoogle.com/

Google will sponsor snacks and drinks - maybe there will even be some swag ;)

• What to bring

• Important to know
events.how_to_find_us: Main entrance, big sign :) See map at: www.orbitlab.au.dk

events.name: Firebase Fundamentals and Perspectives
events.description:
Google’s Firebase https://firebase.google.com/ is a complete Backend-as-a-Service platform with a host of tools and services to make you more productive as a developer. It comes with all the performance, scalability and security from Google’s cloud platform but also have very developer friendly tools and documentation to allow you to build and test your ideas fast – and scale them to robust solutions in production. The focus will be on mobile application development with Android, but there are Firebase integrations for a broad range of platforms, including iOS, web, Unity (VR/AR) and embedded devices (IoT).

16:00 - 16:30: Arrival and Networking
16:30 - 18:00: Tech talk and demos/live coding with focus on technologies in Firebase by Kasper Løvborg Jensen. He will give overview of the core platform tools and APIs and how you can use Firebase to supercharge your mobile applications. Examples will mainly be made in Android/Java but also cover some backend and Google Cloud integration perspectives. You will learn how to build your own Meme generator/social network and a nifty map-based app to keep track of all the cool places you visit.
18:00 - 19:00+: GDG Open Space - ORBIT Lab will be open for hacking and exploring new technologies. You are encouraged to work through some of the Firebase code labs and get started with your own projects, but there will also beopportunities to try out some of our gear for Virtual Reality (HTC Vive, Oculus Rift, Android + Daydream) and Augmented Reality (Android + Tango). Or maybe get hacking on some Android Things IoT projects.

The tech talk and coding session will be in the large auditorium in the Shannon building (S[masked]) and depending on how many we are we will spread out there and in ORBIT Lab (Codd building) for the following hacking.

Bring your laptop and fellow developers!

ORBIT Lab and AU Engineering is hosting the event and Google is sponsoring snacks and drinks, so remember to sign up so we can get get supplies accordingly. Limited spots.

https://orbitlab.au.dk
events.how_to_find_us: The big auditorium in the middle of the building (Room: S009-013)

events.name: I/O Extended Aarhus 2018
events.description:
Tuesday, the 8th of May, Google will stream the Keynote from their annual Google I/O Conference. This is THE biggest event for developers working with Google technologies and we get to hear about what's new and upcoming for the coming year.

Trifork together with Google Developer Group Aarhus wish to provide you with the chance of seeing the keynote in a nice setting with other like-minded nerds – hopefully creating an exciting environment and good discussion. So join us at Dokk1 in Aarhus for this Google I/O Extended event.

The event starts at 17.00 so please be in good time in order to get the good seats, get some Google swag and network before the keynote.

At the event, we will provide free food, snacks and drinks throughout the evening. The Keynote itself will be streamed on a large screen.

We hope to see you for an entertaining and exciting evening full of surprises and announcements from Google.

As always - it is free to attend, but you must sign up here on meetup. Seats are limited.

See you there!

In order to get up to 3rd floor (normally not open to public) on DOKK1, you HAVE to find the elevators on the ground floor (parking lot floor) and take a designated elevator. There will be signs and Trifork employees helping you get up to 3rd floor in batches.
events.how_to_find_us: In order to get up to 3rd floor (normally not open to public) on DOKK1, you HAVE to find the elevators on the ground floor (parking lot floor) and take a designated elevator. There will be signs and Trifork employees helping you get up to 3rd floor.

events.name: Get Flying with Firebase
events.description:
Firebase is complete Backend-as-a-Service concept that works across a wide range of platforms, including Android, iOS, web, IoT and VR. It is very easy to get up and running, and packs a ton of features and services, like authentication, real-time databases, cloud functions, crash analytics, performance monitoring and machine learning for your applications.

16.30 - Arrive and network
17.00 - Tech Talk: Get Flying with Firebase
18.30 - Demos, networking, ...

In this talk, Kasper Løvborg Jensen will give an introduction to Firebase and demonstrate some of the core features of the platform. Focus is on how you can easily add powerful features to your mobile and IoT applications and use Firebase and Google Cloud to scale your applications.

events.name: Cloud Functions for Firebase
events.description:
Kat Fang from the Google Firebase team will visit us in Aarhus and give a tech talk on Cloud Functions and how you can empower your applications with advanced backend processing on Firebase. The talk will cover fundamentals of Cloud Functions and move into advanced tips and strategies for getting the most out of your Functions.

Cloud Functions:
"Cloud Functions for Firebase lets you automatically run backend code in response to events triggered by Firebase features and HTTPS requests. Your code is stored in Google's cloud and runs in a managed environment. There's no need to manage and scale your own servers." https://firebase.google.com/docs/functions/

This is your chance to get expert knowledge directly from a tech lead from the Firebase team, so don't miss out :)

Program:
16.30–17.00: Arrival and networking
17.00–18.00: Tech Talk by Kat Fang, Google Firebase
18.00–18.30: Q&A and discussion
18.30–19.00+: Networking and GDG Open Space in ORBIT Lab

As always, there will be snacks and drinks.

More about the speaker:
Kat is a software engineer working in the intersection between Firebase and Google Cloud. Previously, she helped launch Cloud Storage for Firebase and worked on the Firebase Realtime Database. Kat graduated from MIT with a bachelor's and master's degree in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science. When she's away from her laptop, she spends her time dancing and figure skating.

events.name: Google Hash Code
events.description:
It's time for Hash Code 2019!

Would you like to participate in the annual coding competition organized by Google?

Following quotes are from the official Hash Code site:
https://codingcompetitions.withgoogle.com/hashcode

"Think you could optimize the layout of a Google Data Center? How about scheduling a fleet of drones to make deliveries around the world? Tackle an engineering problem from Google during Hash Code, our team programming competition. Are you up for the challenge?"

"Hash Code is a team programming competition, organized by Google, for students and professionals around the world. You pick your team and programming language and we pick an engineering problem for you to solve. This year’s contest kicks off with an Online Qualification Round, where your team can compete from wherever you’d like, including from one of our Hash Code hubs. Top teams will then be invited to a Google office for the Final Round."

GDG Aarhus and Aarhus University / ORBIT Lab are hosting a hub for the third time - and we would like to have as many contestants as possible! :)

So go check the the Hash Code page and see if it is something for you - and start forming your teams!

NB: You must aslo register on the official Hash Code page and choose the ORBIT Lab hub in Aarhus to secure a seat
events.how_to_find_us: Follow the map, there will be signs on the doors.

events.name: Deep Storage Space Exploration: Using Firebase for Planetary Scale App Missions
events.description:
Firebase is complete Backend-as-a-Service concept that works across a wide range of platforms, including Android, iOS, web, IoT and VR. It is very easy to get up and running, and packs a ton of features and services, like authentication, real-time databases, cloud functions, crash analytics, performance monitoring and machine learning for your applications.

16.30 - Arrive and network
17.00 - Tech Talk, Kasper Løvborg Jensen: "Deep Storage Space Exploration - Using Firebase for Planetary-Scale App Missions"
18.00 - Firebase live coding and demos, Kasper Løvborg Jensen and Simon Kæseler
19.00 - Stay and hack/network if you like

In this talk, Kasper Løvborg Jensen will give an introduction to Firebase and show how the platform can be used to prototype and deploy apps with advanced cloud-based features (see https://firebase.google.com/ ). This will be a broader look at the 'state-of-the-universe' of Firebase and a discussion in the context of how these features can be leveraged for scalable applications.
